data.title: Get Second-level domains from urls
data.statement:
Given an array of links, each representing a URL, the task is to output the second-level of domain name for each URL.

URL can use <<http>> or <<https>> protocol!

Same as urls <<can contains language>> between first part e.g. www. and domain name so be carefull!

Each URL is valid and has a domain name.

Domain names consist of alphanumeric characters and hyphens.

testCases.title: Varied
testCases.testIn:
7
https://github.com/FruGosky
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence
http://www.openai.com/research
https://blog.github.com/
https://www.python.org/doc/
http://www.twitch.tv/
http://adblock.ai
testCases.testOut:
github
wikipedia
openai
github
python
twitch
adblock

data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read url:string(100)
write each domain in single line
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] representing the number of URLs in the array.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> A string representing a URL.
data.outputDescription: <<[[N]] lines:>> The domain name extracted from each URL in the same order as given in the input.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given an array of links, each representing a URL, the task is to output the second-level of domain name for each URL.

URL can use http or https protocol!

Same as urls can contains language between first part e.g. www. and domain name so be carefull!

Each URL is valid and has a domain name.

Domain names consist of alphanumeric characters and hyphens.
Input
Line 1: An integer N representing the number of URLs in the array.
Next N lines: A string representing a URL.
Output
N lines: The domain name extracted from each URL in the same order as given in the input.
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 10
Example
Input
3
https://www.linkedin.com/in/łukasz-komandzik/
https://www.facebook.com/FruGosky/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ
Output
linkedin
facebook
youtube
